meanings.definition: A small body of still water.
meanings.sent1: The children splashed happily in the pools at the park.
meanings.sent2: The ducks swam gracefully in the calm pools of the pond.
meanings.sent3: The tiny fish had a meeting at the pools to discuss their next adventure.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like deep pools of mystery, drawing everyone in.
meanings.sent5: The crystal-clear pools reflected the surrounding trees like mirrors.

meanings.definition: A group of people or things.
meanings.sent1: The pools of students gathered around the teacher for storytime.
meanings.sent2: The pools of colorful balloons brightened up the party.
meanings.sent3: The pools of toys seemed to have a mind of their own, moving around the room.
meanings.sent4: The pools of stars in the night sky twinkled like diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The pools of books in the library offered endless adventures to explore.

meanings.definition: To collect or form a pool.
meanings.sent1: She pools her allowance to buy a special gift for her mom.
meanings.sent2: After the rain, water pools in the low areas of the garden.
meanings.sent3: He pools his resources with friends to organize a surprise party.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight pools in the corner of the room, creating a warm glow.
meanings.sent5: The laughter pools in the room, filling it with joy and happiness.
